citation.article-title: Mycoplasma alligatoris sp. nov., from American alligators.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Mycoplasma alligatoris sp. nov.
Mycoplasma alligatoris (all.ig.a.tor'is. L. gen. n. alligatoris from an alligator)
Cells lack a true cell wall and are surrounded only by cytoplasmic membrane.
Colonies on solid medium with 0.8% agar exhibit typical fried-egg morphology at low magnification.
Does not hydrolyse arginine nor urea.
Serum or sterol required for sustained growth.
Serologically distinct from all other established Mycoplasma species.
Isolated from multiple organs, blood, synovial fluid and cerebrospinal fluid of diseased American alligators (Alligator mississippiensis) in Florida.
The organism is a lethal pathogen of alligators.
The 16S rRNA gene nucleotide sequence is unique.
